Key:
(As a result of the day's events, we're now
shopping for a dinner cook-off at home.)

But our kitchen doesn't have enough space for
everyone to cook. What are we going to do about
that?

There are kitchens in the Spirit Mansion as well.
They can all cook there and bring their food over.
Ah, I see. Uh... so are you participating, too?

Kinda. I mean, this event is right out of the gal
game book. Participating means a higher chance
we'll be able to progress further and escape.
Can... you even cook?

Well, I'll figure something out. Besides, aren't
there more people you need to be worried about?
Dear sister, don't remind me...

Hmmm, what will be on the menu for tonight... Oh!
Something smells good!
Shido, Shido! What is that pan-fried squid"?! Is

Operator: it good? It is, isn't it?!"

Key:
Yeah, it is. But let's not get it today. We're
about to cook together.

Tohka Yatogami has already set herself apart as
the loser. She shouldn't be distracted by other
foods while shopping for the meal of a lifetime.

Origami, why are you heading into the drug store?!
I saw you reading the sign just now, and you're
still going in!

In China, there is a saying that doctors and food
are from the same root.

That's not what it means! And let's just stick
to the supermarket for ingredients! Please!

Well, just as I suspected. Feels like everyone's
going to whip up something dangerous.
So who's left...
What do I do... What should I make, Yoshinon?
Anything you make will be delicious if you make\nit with love! But if you ask me, you might have\nbetter success if you tell him, 'Please eat me—'

Oh, am I not allowed to call for help? I was going
to have a girl from the Rindouji Cooking Club help
me.

Oh well ♪ Darling said he would be my fan until
the very end, so I'm sure he'll enjoy my cooking～

I'm going to squeeze out the contents of my heart
and pour it into your dinner. It will be my finest
offering, darling...

...I thought she'd be okay, but she may not be the
best either.
Hey guys, is this really going to be okay?

Well, the Yamai Sisters and Kurumi seemed to be
confident, so you probably won't die... I mean,
in the end, this is a virtual world anyways.

That's your reasoning?! Then you're pretty much
telling me if this were the real world, I would
probably die!

Well, if you really die here, there's a chance you
might go into shock in the real world and die
there, too.
How can you say that so casually?!

Like I said, you'll be okay! You probably won't
die, you'll just feel like you are!

I am going to go off on my own. I don't want to
know anyone's plans or let anyone know mine.
I don't think it would be fair.

O-Okay. Please, can you make something normal?
I don't have high hopes for the others...

My, my. Well then, please look forward
to my cooking.
Now... Everyone, let's go in.
Mmm! This looks delicious! I want to eat this!

What do you say, Shido? Don't you think it looks
good? You can pan fry or simmer meat.
It's delicious!

Weak. At this point we know who will
be victorious.
Wh-What did you say...?!

You're just choosing what you want to eat. It's
not in Shido's best interests.

Grrr... I-I'm just choosing delicious things.
Shido likes delicious things too, you know!

But people have their own preferences. Also, if
you repeat the same types of cooking, you'll get
bored of it. I know all of Shido's daily meals.
Hey, wait! Why?! How do you know?!

And Tohka, you eat the same food as Shido every
day, so wouldn't it be the same?

Ever since Tohka Yatogami started to beg for food,
Shido's cooked meat-type dishes to match her
preference. It's not what he usually likes.

I-Is that really so...?! Grrr, then Origami
Tobiichi, what do you choose?!

If it were me, I wouldn't choose anything lined up
there.
What?! What do you mean by that?!

Shido is currently lacking the adequate vegetable
intake... I believe I heard him muttering so in
the bathroom, so I am sure of it.

Origami?! Origami-san?! I do remember saying that!
But how did you even hear it?!

That's why tonight's menu will be vegetable-based.
Unlike you, Tohka Yatogami, I can say that I am
already victorious at the food selection process.
You were about to go into the pharmacy earlier...

Hey... But you do lack something,
Origami Tobiichi!
That is impossible on every level.

Hehehe... Yoshino told me during class that
passion yields greater results! And I like to
eat more than you do, Origami Tobiichi!

Tohka Yatogami's attachment to eating is
abnormal... I see. I can't let my guard down,
then.

Hehe... You have a point. A sense of attachment
will increase your abilities from time to time.

Flashback. Kaguya was victorious during the first
cooking battle. Kaguya is more of a pig compared
to Yuzuru. No wonder I lost.

Hehe... However, Yuzuru's fire of life created the
Golden Artifact. That was incredibly delicious.

Assumption. You are talking about the omelette.
This time, we can create an evolved version of it.
With your sauce, Kaguya, it will be perfect.
Hey, what happened to Miku and Yoshino?

They went to the shopping district. I'm sure
people will be nice to those two. They might
even get some good tips.
I see. You're not going to go?

How many years do you think we've been siblings?
I know everything you like. Leave it to me.

Hmmmm... Hm! This! This meat seems the most
delicious.

Given Shido's current diet, his height, his
weight, and his exercise time... I'm going to
plan the perfect intake of vitamins and minerals.
I wonder how this is going to pan out...

That reminds me. I should probably go buy
something for indigestion.

(And the cook-off has begun. I'm sure I'll be
bored just waiting around. Maybe I can help
someone.)
(Who should I help...?)
Tohka
Origami
Kotori
Yoshino
Next
Kurumi
The Yamai Sisters
Miku
Back
*Grunt*... This is starting to hurt.

(I may have eaten too much... And some of the
dishes were questionable, to say the least.)
I'm kind of... getting sick. Hm...?

(I just realized. There's dessert.
Who made that...?)

Is it pudding... or bavarois? Judging from the
color, there seem to be some fruits in it.

...Yeah, it's a little sweet and tart.
Pineapple... figs? And some yogurt.

Ah... This is so good. I can feel my stomach
finally settling.

(It was a little over-steamed and not strained
completely, so the texture was a bit grainy but...
I didn't care. It just tasted so nice.)

Yeah... That was good... I think I like this one
the most.
Wh-What?! But that's not my cooking, Shido!

What...? You're going to ignore the golden egg
of the Yamai Sisters?
Objection. I would say our cooking was better.

I-I was too busy thinking about cooking... Maybe I
wasn't considering Shido-san eating it...

Figs and pineapple have digestive enzymes. Yogurt
has the effect of regulating the intestines.

I have been calculating Shido's caloric intake up
to today. However, I hadn't calculated the actual
dinner to include any unpredictable factors.

(I feel for Origami's cooking, it wasn't a matter
of strategy...)

It's true that I wasn't thinking to that extent.
As much as I'd hate to admit it, maybe I have
lost.

I see. I now understand how I lost. Besides,
it looked delicious!
But who made this?

It wasn't me. If it matches your tastes,
darling... Could it be Kotori-chan?
No. It seems like Arusu made that.

Arusu...? Come to think of it, she was in the
kitchen too... I didn't notice...
(Well, it was chaotic in there.)
Then Arusu is the winner. So, where did she go?
She's gone... Maybe she went out?
Alone? But it's late... I'm worried.
It's fine. This is her world.

Even so, I can't just leave her alone. I'll go
look for her.
Okay. Then we'll be cleaning up.
Oh, you're not going to tell me I shouldn't go?

I just thought if it were you... you might have
the ability to show Arusu what she's looking
for...

What she's looking for... You know what? Well,
fine. I'll come right back as soon as I find her.

Okay, okay. Go already. You're so you.
Take care, Onii-chan.
Okay!
